Title: Tacit Knowledge Elicitation for Shop-floor Workers with an Intelligent Assistant
Authors: Samuel Kernan Freire, Chaofan Wang, Santiago Ruiz-Arenas, E. Niforatos
Abstract summary: An intelligent assistant system can elicit tacit knowledge from workers through systematic reflection and data visualization.

Title: Production Assessment Using a Knowledge Transfer Framework and Evidence Theory
Authors: Fernando Arévalo, C. Piolo, Tahasanul Ibrahim, Andreas Schwung
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a methodology for formalizing tacit operational knowledge into explicit knowledge for AI systems in industrial operations.

Title: Tacit knowledge elicitation process for industry 4.0
Authors: Enzo Fenoglio, Emre Kazim, Hugo Latapie, A. Koshiyama
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a tacit knowledge elicitation process using domain ontologies, reasoning techniques, and a cooperative game to capture operational best practices of experienced workers for Industry 4.0.

Title: Gathering Expert Knowledge in Process Industry
Authors: Sabrina Luftensteiner, Georgios C. Chasparis, Michael Mayr
Abstract summary: The paper reviews strategies and approaches for eliciting and representing tacit knowledge from industrial experts to improve AI systems in industrial operations.

Title: Some methodological aspects of tacit knowledge elicitation
Venue: Journal of experimental and theoretical artificial intelligence (Print)
Abstract summary: The paper discusses methodological challenges in eliciting and formalizing tacit knowledge for expert systems, including the role of visual stimulus, expert strategies, and the significance of end-insight.

Title: Methodology for acquisition of collective tacit knowledge used in diagnosis of defect cause in industrial processes
Authors: Cláudio Roberto do Rosário, L. M. Kipper, Rejane Frozza, B. B. Mariani
Abstract summary: The paper presents a methodology for eliciting and formalizing collective tacit knowledge used in diagnosing defect causes in industrial processes.

Title: A formal methodology for acquiring and representing expert knowledge
Authors: Nancy M. Cooke, J. E. McDonald
Abstract summary: A formal methodology is proposed to elicit and represent expert knowledge, including tacit knowledge, for knowledge-based systems.

Title: How and why we need to capture tacit knowledge in manufacturing: Case studies of visual inspection.
Authors: T. L. Johnson, S. Fletcher, W. Baker, R. Charles
Abstract summary: Systematic task analysis methods can effectively elicit tacit knowledge in visual inspection tasks to enable sharing and utilization in manufacturing.
